name: World Wide Workshop
tag_list: gaming, education, k-12, technology, stem, computing
overview:
The World Wide Workshop develops applications for learning with technology that combine game mechanics and social networking to empower youth to be inventors and leaders in the global knowledge economy.

The Workshop’s programs seek to transform education by connecting youth to learning, community engagement and economic development through game production. Its flagship initiative is Globaloria, a game design curriculum in use by more than 80 schools and 2000 students and teachers in New York, West Virginia, California, Texas and Florida. Current partners include Microsoft, Google, Adobe, EA, the Entertainment Software Association, the Knight Foundation and Motorola Mobility Foundation.

Recent research has found that Globaloria positively impacts participating students’ STEM and computing skills and interest in pursuing STEM-related careers. The World Wide Workshop is also working to close digital literacy divides in underserved communities across the country.
